name: The Talented Marlee Matlin Trivia Quiz | Celebrities | 10 Questions

questions.explanation:
August 24, 1965.

	Marlee Beth Matlin was born in Morton Grove, Illinois.

questions.text: What illness caused Marlee Matlin to become deaf when she was 18 months old?
questions.explanation:
Roseola Infantum.

	Roseola Infantum is a childhood disease that usually affects children between the ages of six to twenty-four months of age. It's symptoms incude a very high fever followed by a rash. The illness usually lasts 3-7 days.  http://www.kidshealth.org/parent/infections/skin/roseola.html

Children of a Lesser God.

	Marlee Matlin plays Sarah Norman in "Children of a Lesser God".  Her performance earned her an Oscar at age 21, and at that time she was the youngest actress ever to win the Oscar, one of only four women to win it for a debut performance, as well as being the first deaf person to win the award.

Nicaragua.

	While in Nicaragua, Marlee Matlin took time to visit the children in the country. This is the same for all other countries she has been in as well.

questions.text: What is significant about when Marlee Matlin's character, Mayor Laurie Bey ("Picket Fences") gave birth on TV?

options: That episode helped her win the Emmy Award that year

Marlee Matlin gave birth to her daughter Sarah that same day.

	The same thing happend to Lucille Ball exactly 43 years prior to that episode of "Picket Fences".  Both shows were on CBS.

questions.text: Has Marlee Matlin ever written any books?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	In 2004, Marlee Matlin wrote "Deaf Child Crossing" and in 2006 she wrote "Nobody's Perfect".  Both books are written for older children ages about 8-12.

questions.text: At which Superbowl did Marlee Matlin sing the National Anthem?
questions.explanation:
Superbowl XXVII.

	The Dallas Cowboys beat the Buffalo Bills in that Superbowl. The final score was 52-17.

questions.text: What national organization is Marlee Matlin a spokesperson for?
questions.explanation:
America Red Cross.

	Marlee Matlin became a spokesperson in 1995. The Red Cross was founded by Clara Barton in 1881.

questions.text: Thanks to Marlee Matlin's efforts all TVs in the USA, that are manufactured after 1993 and are larger than thirteen inches, have to have _________ ?
questions.explanation:
closed caption.

	In 1990 Congress passed the Television Decoder Circuitry Act. Marlee Matlin was very instrumental in getting this Act passed. Closed captioning are similar to subtitles, but even better because not only does it show what people are saying it also shows sound effects such as "Jake laughs" or "gunshot". This allows people who are deaf to "hear" a show or movie.Closed captioning is also a good way for hearing children to learn how to read since they can see the words as the person is speaking. I also find, as a hearing person, that it is great for words in a show or movie that are hard to understand, or are spoken too softly.

questions.text: Who did Marlee Matlin marry in 1993?
questions.explanation:
Kevin Grandalski.

	Kevin Grandalski, a police officer, married Marlee Matlin on August 29, 1993.
